meanings.definition: Fit or safe for a voyage at sea.
meanings.sent1: The sturdy ship was deemed seaworthy for the long journey ahead.
meanings.sent2: The captain only trusted seaworthy vessels to sail in rough waters.
meanings.sent3: The inflatable duck-shaped boat may not look seaworthy, but it surprisingly held up well.
meanings.sent4: Her resolve was as seaworthy as a well-built ship, unwavering in the face of challenges.
meanings.sent5: The old lighthouse stood tall and proud, a symbol of seaworthy endurance.

meanings.definition: Capable of withstanding the conditions of the sea.
meanings.sent1: The reinforced hull made the boat seaworthy against the powerful waves.
meanings.sent2: Only the most seaworthy vessels could navigate the treacherous waters of the storm.
meanings.sent3: The seaworthy life jacket kept him afloat even in the choppiest of seas.
meanings.sent4: Her friendship was like a seaworthy anchor, keeping me steady in turbulent times.
meanings.sent5: The seaworthy lighthouse guided ships safely through the night, a beacon of hope.
